Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Obama decreed the removal of the phrase "In God We Trust" from all U.S. currency.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fictional article from the National Report.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Obama has the power to unilaterally change the appearance of the motto on U.S. currency, which is not the case according to the expert's verdict.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that legislation passed in 1955 makes the appearance of the motto "In God We Trust" mandatory on all U.S. coins and paper currency.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the fictional article was created to provoke outrage and spread misinformation.
